summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 8, 2019, detailing operational status, staff shortages, inmate movements, and administrative data. It is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's conditions and staffing levels around the time Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there.

events.title: Daily Operations and Staffing Report
events.description: The report documents the daily activities at MCC New York, including inmate movements to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and suicide watch, multiple correctional assignments being vacated due to staff shortages, and an inoperative fire panel.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report is dated August 9, 2019, and covers activities for August 8, 2019, placing it within the timeframe of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at MCC New York.
Multiple correctional assignments (Internal 12, 10 South 12, SHU #4, 10-South #2) were vacated due to staff shortages, indicating potential security or monitoring lapses.
An inmate was placed on suicide watch during the evening shift on August 8, 2019.
The facility's Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative.
The report shows high use of sick leave (05) and instances of AWOL (11) among staff for the period.
